banners.priority: 🚀 Feb 17: 5 tasks completed autonomously while Mike was AFK. Memory split, CUV gates, Build-in-Public upgrades, Auto-Ingest, MCP globalized.
banners.parallel: Run up to 5 tasks in parallel on claude.ai. Click “Launch” to copy the task prompt and open a new Claude tab. Paste (Ctrl+V) and hit Enter. Each runs independently.

cards.title: Wispr Flow Deep Dive & Mic Lock Fix
cards.description: Full audit of Wispr Flow voice dictation: Ctrl+Space conflict check (clean), system resource check (clean), config.json diagnostic analysis revealing 38 mic switches → 96 cancelled transcripts → 64 paste failures. Root cause: overrideAudioDeviceId set to dynamic 'communications' instead of specific device. Fix: locked to Blue Snowball device hash. Drafted feedback for Wispr Flow team (email, X, roadmap). Feb 17.

cards.title: Dashboard Deploy Sync Protocol
cards.description: Cloned demko-dashboard deploy repo, synced kanban_dashboard.html → index.html, pushed to GitHub Pages. Fixed stale deploy missing Done-on-top layout, leaderboard toggle, chain arrows, and scoring badges. Feb 16.

cards.title: 3D Scoring Framework
cards.description: Replaced simple impact/effort ROI with Amplification × Creative / Effort in meta_learning_loop.py. New dimensions: Amplification (1-10, downstream outputs affected), Creative (1-10, novel thinking vs mechanical). Updated dataclass, Stage 2 prompt, output formatting, and memory capture. Feb 16.

cards.title: End-to-End Stress Test
cards.description: Full pipeline validated: /ci-swarm (6 competitors, 87KB report) → strategic-reviewer CUV audit (3 rounds, 6.6→9.0/10) → hooks verified (audit logger, file protection, session context). Found & fixed 2 gaps: wired CUV Stop Gate + Anti-Rationalization Gate into Stop hooks. Feb 16.

cards.title: Write Flo Health Project Instructions
cards.description: CLAUDE_FloHealth.md — full board intelligence playbook derived from 7 corpus files. Competitor table, 6 strategic themes, Synthetic Council config, artifact standards, demo readiness checklist. Built autonomously while user was away. Feb 16.

cards.title: End-of-Day Handoff Protocol
cards.description: HANDOFF_PROTOCOL.md — task block template, model selection guide, P1-P5 priority ranking, context payload guide, morning verification checklist, sample Flo CI sweep, anti-patterns. Built by parallel agent. Feb 16.

cards.title: Tighten Kill Filter Prompts
cards.description: 3 fixes in extract_recording_feedback.py: cross-claim deduplication (Kill 1), 16h effort ceiling hard gate (Kill 4), metrics-as-features bug with regex safety net. 34 false BUILD candidates → 7 real ones. Built by parallel agent. Feb 16.

cards.title: P0 — Hooks Layer (Deterministic Enforcement)
cards.description: CUV Stop Gate, Audit Logger, File Protection, Anti-Rationalization Gate, Session Context Injection, PreCompact Backup, Windows Notification. All 7 hooks wired in settings.local.json. Feb 16.

cards.title: P1 — Skills Layer (One-Command Workflows)
cards.description: /ci-swarm, /red-team, /strategic-brief, /recording-feedback, /session-close — 5 skills in .claude/skills/. Feb 16.

cards.title: P3 — Context Management (Compaction Survival)
cards.description: PreCompact backup hook, SessionStart reload, auto-compact at 50%, bash output cap, compaction directives in CLAUDE.md. Feb 16.

cards.title: P4 — Custom Subagents (4 Specialized Agents)
cards.description: ci-researcher (haiku), strategic-reviewer (sonnet), doc-fixer (haiku), codebase-auditor (haiku) in .claude/agents/. Feb 16.

cards.title: CI Header Validation Fix
cards.description: Batch-fixed 15 legacy artifacts missing Canonical_Location, Artifact_Owner, Modification_Policy, Status fields. CI now green. Feb 16.

cards.title: Fix CLAUDE.md Protocol Contradictions
cards.description: Fixed 3 red team findings: pre-flight gate opt-out consolidation, recursive lessons circular dep (exempt autonomous actions), SESSION_AUDIT collision (session ID in filename). Feb 16.

cards.title: Organize Root Directory
cards.description: 222 files → organized into ci_reports/, transcripts/, media/, red_team_results/, session_logs/, recording_feedback/. Feb 16.

cards.title: Deploy Identity Rules to Claude.ai
cards.description: Automated via deploy_claude_profile.py. Profile + Project Instructions deployed to claude.ai. Feb 16.

cards.title: Complete GitHub CLI Auth
cards.description: gh in PATH, git push working, branch synced to origin/master. Feb 16.

cards.title: NotebookLM Transcript Loop
cards.description: notebooklm_loop.py — single command: download → compress → transcribe → extract → red team. Feb 16.

cards.title: Profile Sync Automation
cards.description: deploy_claude_profile.py — Playwright Edge automation deploys CLAUDE_AI_PROFILE_INSTRUCTIONS.md to claude.ai. Feb 16.

cards.title: P0 — Understand CLAUDE.md v1.6→v1.8 Evolution
cards.description: Another session evolved CLAUDE.md through 3 versions (v1.6→v1.7→v1.8) with major changes you haven't reviewed yet. Key changes: (1) CUV restructured from 5-item checklist to 4-dimension + frontier retro-check lens model, (2) Frontier Whisper added for TIER 1 — passive frontier awareness on tactical tasks, (3) CRITIQUE_FRAMEWORK.md created with full convergence criteria, (4) FRONTIER_SIGNALS.md referenced as evidence source, (5) 47-finding red team (4 models) drove v1.8. Files to review: INTELLIGENCE_DELTA.md (full changelog), CLAUDE.md Rule 3 (CUV), CLAUDE.md Rule 4 (Frontier Whisper), CRITIQUE_FRAMEWORK.md. Feb 16. Reviewed Feb 17.

cards.title: API Key Inventory Sync (Google Doc → Global)
cards.description: Synced all API keys from canonical Google Doc to Windows user env vars + .env. Added 6 missing keys: GEMINI_API_KEY, XAI_API_KEY, X_CLIENT_ID, X_CLIENT_SECRET, N8N_API_KEY, GOOGLE_AI_STUDIO_API_KEY. Updated DEEPSEEK_API_KEY to match doc. All 17 keys now in .env + Windows env. Feb 17.

cards.title: Globalize MCP Servers for Claude Code CLI
cards.description: Moved gdrive MCP from project-scoped to global mcpServers in .claude.json. gdrive now works from any directory. Feb 17.
cards.launch_prompt: Fix MCP server scope in Claude Code. Current state: .claude.json has 'mcpServers': {} at global level but gdrive is only configured under project 'C:/Demko_Local_Project/Demko Meta OS 2'. Steps: (1) Copy gdrive MCP config to global mcpServers section in .claude.json, (2) Verify gdrive_mcp_server.py works from any directory (uses absolute paths — should be fine), (3) Add N8n MCP server if available, (4) Test: launch Claude Code from home dir, verify gdrive tools appear in /mcp, (5) Document which MCPs are cloud-hosted (Gamma via claude.ai) vs local (gdrive via stdio).

cards.title: Install Agent SDK Dev Plugin
cards.description:
Step 1: Open Claude Desktop
Step 2: Click Plugins in sidebar
Step 3: Find 'Agent SDK Dev'
Step 4: Click Install

That's it — ~1 min.

cards.title: Install Claude in Chrome Extension
cards.description:
Step 1: Open Chrome (work profile)
Step 2: Go to Chrome Web Store
Step 3: Search 'Claude'
Step 4: Click 'Add to Chrome'

Use work/separate Chrome profile — NOT personal account. Enables browser automation from Claude Code. ~2 min.

cards.title: Launch Button → Claude Code CLI
cards.description: Protocol handler registered (claude-code:// in HKCU registry, claude-code-launcher.bat). Dashboard launchTask() fires claude-code://launch?prompt=... URL. Fixed Feb 17: changed -p (print mode, blank screen) to interactive mode. Tested and working — Windows Terminal opens with Claude Code session pre-loaded with task prompt.

cards.title: Phase 2 — Memory Architecture Split (3-Tier)
cards.description: MEMORY.md split into 3 tiers: (1) RULES layer (<150 lines, loaded into prompt), (2) KNOWLEDGE topic files (linked, fetched on demand), (3) LEARNINGS.md (append-only session lessons, not in prompt). Session-close protocol updated to route lessons to LEARNINGS.md. Self-referential TIER 2 rule added. Feb 17.
cards.launch_prompt: In C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2 and ~/.claude/projects/.../memory/: Phase 2 Memory Architecture Split. (1) Create LEARNINGS.md — move all session lessons from MEMORY.md here, append-only format with dates. (2) Slim MEMORY.md to RULES ONLY — preferences, shorthand commands, stack info, protocol pointers. Target <150 lines. (3) Verify all topic files (llm_aggregator_research.md etc) are linked in Reference Files section. (4) Add self-referential rule at top of MEMORY.md: 'Any edit to this file is TIER 2 (CUV required).' (5) Update session-close protocol to route lessons → LEARNINGS.md, not MEMORY.md. (6) Test: start new session, verify MEMORY.md loads clean, verify topic files are findable.

cards.title: Build in Public — Daily Auto-Post to X
cards.description: Full implementation: build_in_public.py (git log → AI draft → Tweepy post → archive), .env with X API keys, pip install deps, Windows Scheduled Task at 6 PM daily. Posts to @futureproofedge. Needs X Developer account created first. Feb 16.
cards.launch_prompt: Implement the Build in Public daily auto-post system in C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2. Create build_in_public.py that: 1) Runs git log --since=midnight --oneline on the Demko repo, 2) Skips if no commits, 3) Sends commit messages to OpenAI API to draft a layperson-friendly tweet (≤280 chars) emphasizing time saved/cool factor with #BuildInPublic, 4) Posts via Tweepy client.create_tweet(), 5) Appends to tweet_archive.md. Also: create .env with X API key placeholders, pip install tweepy python-dotenv openai, create Windows Scheduled Task for 6 PM daily, test end-to-end.

cards.title: Frontier Signals Pipeline (Twitter/X)
cards.description: Weekly batch: scrape/summarize top 10 builders' Twitter/X feeds → FRONTIER_SIGNALS.md. Referenced during CUV dim 5 retro-check and Frontier Whisper. Solves training-data staleness (red team Theme 4). Uses existing GROK_API_KEY for X API. Integrate into Friday CI Swarm schedule. Output: structured artifact with signals clustered by theme (AI agents, prompt eng, meta-cognitive systems).
cards.launch_prompt: Build frontier_signals.py in C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2. It should: 1) Read a curated list of Twitter/X accounts from frontier_builders.txt (one handle per line), 2) Use GROK_API_KEY to fetch recent tweets (last 7 days) from each account, 3) Filter for signal (technical insights, tool announcements, pattern shifts) vs noise (personal, promotional), 4) Cluster signals by theme, 5) Output FRONTIER_SIGNALS.md with structured format: ## Theme > - Signal: [Builder] observation > - Source: tweet URL. 6) Integrate into run_weekly_ci.bat to run alongside CI Swarm on Fridays. Graceful degradation if GROK_API_KEY missing.

cards.title: Build in Public Content Flywheel — CUV Upgrades
cards.description: 5 CUV upgrades implemented: U1 engagement window reminder, U2 constellation format (standalone + quote-tweets), U3 metrics injection (streak/day/time-saved), U4 engagement hit list (5 accounts after posting), U5 blog/index.html with navigation. --dry-run flag added. Feb 17.
cards.launch_prompt: Implement the 5 CUV upgrades for build_in_public.py in C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2: U1 Add engagement window reminder (post within 30 min of high-traffic times). U2 Switch from long threads to constellation format (standalone tweets + quote-tweets). U3 Inject streak counter, day number, and time-saved stats into tweet opener. U4 After posting, generate an engagement hit list of 5 accounts to reply to. U5 Create blog/index.html with navigation across all blog posts. Test with --dry-run flag. Commit when done.

cards.title: Google Drive Full Access (OAuth2 + Write Tools)
cards.description: REPLACED domain-wide delegation approach (requires Workspace admin, doesn't work for personal accounts) with OAuth2 user consent flow. One-time browser auth saves token.json with full Drive/Docs/Sheets read+write access. MCP server rewritten v2.0: added gdrive_create_doc, gdrive_upload_file, gdrive_create_folder tools. Falls back to service account (readonly) if token missing. No more per-folder sharing. Feb 17.

cards.title: X Engagement Tracker — Polish & Ship
cards.description: Phase 1-2 complete: engagement_tracker.py, render_engagement.py, influencer_watchlist.json all working. --demo produces 8-tweet dashboard with sparklines, influencer grid, and growth charts. TODO: user feedback pass, test --fetch with live API, --init-watchlist to resolve user IDs, deploy dashboard to GitHub Pages. Feb 16.

cards.title: Plan & Write Origin Story Narrative
cards.description: Life hacker → factory architect story. 7-act arc planned: (1) The Addiction — 15yr friction-killing pattern, (2) Copywriting Lineage — Ogilvy, Kennedy, Schwartz, Hormozi, (3) The Kyle Moment — zero fracking knowledge → $12M pitch, (4) Human Router Problem — copy-paste between AI tools, (5) Claude Code Arrives — 90/10 flip, (6) Factory Takes Shape — Meta OS with adversarial truth, CUV, 3 surfaces, multi-model red team, (7) Infinite Leverage Thesis — 1% compounding, READ-WRITE 100x. Weave in influence_list.md (30+ names). All source material gathered and reviewed. Ready to write.

cards.title: Auto-Ingest System
cards.description: auto_ingest.py built: reads accretive_evaluation_report.json, finds INGEST-tagged items, copies to knowledge corpus, updates index. Handles missing files, deduplication. Feb 17.
cards.launch_prompt: Build auto_ingest.py in C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2. It should: 1) Read the latest accretive_evaluation_report.json, 2) Find items tagged for INGEST, 3) Copy them into the knowledge corpus (used by knowledge_corpus_rag.py), 4) Update knowledge_corpus_index.json. Follow the INGEST_PIPELINE_CONTRACT__v1.0.md for artifact standards. Test by running it against the current accretive report.

cards.title: Mobile Capture Pipeline
cards.description: End-to-end test: Pixel 9a → Google Recorder → Drive → Claude Code ingestion.

cards.title: Interactive Dashboard Rewrite
cards.description: Complete architectural rewrite of Kanban dashboard. Eliminated fragile 4-step pipeline (edit JSON → python render → copy repo → git push). New version: client-side JS rendering, live GitHub API fetch on load (no more stale cache), clickable Done buttons with hours-saved modal, GitHub API persistence via PAT. One deploy, then all updates happen from the dashboard itself. Feb 16.

cards.title: Collapse Done Section (Show Recent 10)
cards.description: Done section shows only the 10 most recent completed cards by default. 'Show N more' expander button reveals the rest. Feb 17.
cards.launch_prompt: In C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2\render_dashboard.py, modify the client-side JS render() function so the Done section only shows the 10 most recent cards initially. Add a 'Show N more' expander button below the visible cards that reveals the rest when clicked. Sort done cards by most recently completed (use card array order as proxy — newest cards are appended last). Style the expander to match existing dashboard aesthetics.

cards.title: MEMORY.md Write Protection (CUV Gate)
cards.description: 3-layer write protection: (1) CLAUDE.md Pre-Flight Gate reclassified (MEMORY.md=TIER 2, CLAUDE.md=TIER 3, LEARNINGS.md=EXEMPT), (2) memory-cuv-gate.sh hook (exit 2 blocking), (3) Self-referential rule in MEMORY.md header. Wired into settings.local.json. Feb 17.
chains: All future MEMORY.md and CLAUDE.md writes
cards.launch_prompt: Implement 3-layer MEMORY.md write protection in C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2: (1) In CLAUDE.md Pre-Flight Gate section, reclassify MEMORY.md writes as TIER 2 and CLAUDE.md writes as TIER 3. (2) Create a PreToolUse advisory hook script (memory-cuv-gate.sh) that warns when Edit or Write targets *MEMORY.md or *CLAUDE.md files. (3) Add a self-referential protection rule in the MEMORY.md header. Reference red_team_input_memory_cuv_gate.md for full spec. Prerequisite: LEARNINGS.md must exist first. Commit when done.

cards.title: Fix Claude Code Invalid Settings Files (4 errors)
cards.description: Diagnosed and fixed all invalid Claude Code settings files flagged by /doctor. 3 issue types across 8 files: (A) 6 invalid top-level keys in project settings.json (permissionMode, model, etc), (B) heredoc garbage accidentally saved as Bash permissions in 2 worktree settings, (C) invalid SessionStart/PreCompact hook events in 4 files. All cleaned. Feb 17.

cards.title: Evaluate OpenRouter as Unified API Layer
cards.description: Research whether OpenRouter (1% markup, 200+ models, OpenAI-compatible, caching, auto-fallback) makes sense as a routing layer on top of existing direct API keys (Anthropic, OpenAI, DeepSeek, Poe, Gemini). Would unify billing, add failover, and simplify red_team_review.py multi-model calls. Compare: current direct-to-provider cost vs OpenRouter markup. Low priority — costs aren't a concern, this is an optimization play.
cards.launch_prompt: Research OpenRouter as a unified API routing layer. Compare: (1) Current direct-to-provider costs (Anthropic, OpenAI, DeepSeek, Gemini) vs OpenRouter 1% markup. (2) Feature comparison: caching, auto-fallback, rate limit handling, model availability. (3) Evaluate if red_team_review.py multi-model calls would simplify with OpenRouter's OpenAI-compatible endpoint. (4) Write a recommendation memo to C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2\research\openrouter_evaluation.md with a go/no-go verdict and migration plan if go.
